law.text:
The governing body of a municipal corporation may make an agreement under § 50 of this subtitle with the governing body of a privately owned residential community that:
Lies wholly or partially in the boundaries of the municipal corporation;
Has at least one-quarter mile of roadway;
Regarding a roadway in the privately owned residential community that is to be used for the delivery of a residential street service:
Permits the roadway to be dedicated to public use; and
Unless maintenance of the roadway is provided by the municipal corporation, maintains the roadway at a level of service satisfactory to the municipal corporation; and
Agrees to pay any insurance riders that the municipal corporation requires to enable vehicles owned or contracted by the municipal corporation to operate on a roadway in the privately owned residential community.
